article_title: Ohio Has a Ministry of Truth, And It Isn't Much Better Than George Orwell's

article_metadata.description: Can politics be cleaned of lies, spin, and allegations? Can a government agency—an Orwellian “Ministry of Truth”—police political rhetoric in order to determine what is true, what is false, and what is, as Stephen Colbert would say, “truthy”? Not if we want to uphold the values of the First Amendment.
article_metadata.author: Trevor Burrus
